title: Drawing, "Interior of Wine Distillery, probably for the Service Agronomique", 1831–44
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, border in pen and brown ink, lined
dimensions:
21 x 25.3 cm (81/4 x 9 15/16 in.) sheet
14.1 cm (5 9/16 in. ), diameter image
description: Scene in a wine cellar.  A man, right forground, appears to be filling a barrel from a large vat of wine in the right middleground.  He then passes the barrel along to workers who store the barrels in a connecting room viewed through a door in the right background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Interior of Wine Distillery, probably for the Service Agronomique", 1831–44.
1831–44. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, border in pen and brown ink, lined. Gift of Joseph F. McCrindle. 1980-2-5.
